NHL Roundup: Avalanche shut out Sharks to win 10th straight game
The Colorado Avalanche achieved their 10th consecutive victory by shutting out the San Jose Sharks, marking the longest win streak in the NHL this season. Nathan MacKinnon scored his NHL-leading 18th goal, while goaltender Mackenzie Blackwood posted a perfect 26 saves. The Avalanche's defensive prowess was highlighted by a third shutout in a row, extending their goal-less streak to over 189 minutes. Colorado has also set an NHL-high point streak of 14 games with a record of 12-0-2 during this period. Other key players contributing to the victory included Artturi Lehkonen and Josh Manson, each adding to the team's offensive surge.
By the Numbers- Nathan MacKinnon leads the NHL with 18 goals this season.
- The Avalanche’s current point streak stands at 14 games (12-0-2).
- They have now recorded shutouts in three consecutive games.
- The Avalanche's win streak is tied for the second-longest in franchise history.
- Colorado has not allowed a goal in 189 minutes and 17 seconds.
- Blackwood's recent performances have improved, achieving two consecutive shutouts.
As the Avalanche continue their successful run, they will aim to extend both their win and point streaks in the upcoming games, solidifying their position as a playoff contender. Key matchups will determine if they can maintain momentum against other leading teams in the league.
Bottom LineThe Avalanche’s current streak showcases their powerful offense and impenetrable defense, setting them apart as serious contenders in the NHL this season. Their collective performance highlights their potential to challenge for the championship if they maintain this level of play.
